page.title: 09BETTYHILL IN THE NEWS
page.content: {Bettyhill in the news } The village was in the news in the month of June 1985 for a variety of reasons. 1. Two Bettyhill men were elected as union representatives for the area in a newly formed Crofters' Union. 2. The Secondary and Primary pupils performed two plays The Last Flower (Pr) and The Crunch (Sec). 3. Primary schools from North Sutherland competed in the annual sports day at Farr School. 1st. Melvich, 2nd. Altnaharra/Tongue, 3rd. Bettyhill. 4. The Church of Scotland Minister for the last 10 years was leaving the district in August. 5. The Sutherland Archaeology and History Society held an outing on the banks of Loch Naver. 6. Fourteen pupils and two teachers from Farr School went on an educational tour to London.
